# ğŸš€ LangGPT â€” Empowering Everyone to Create High-Quality Prompts!
[![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-MIT-blue.svg)](/LICENSE) [![Status](https://img.shields.io/badge/status-active-success.svg)]() [![Paper](https://img.shields.io/badge/arXiv-2402.16929-b31b1b.svg)](https://arxiv.org/abs/2402.16929) [![Stars](https://badgen.net/github/stars/langgptai/LangGPT)](https://github.com/langgptai/LangGPT) [English](README.md) | [ç®€ä½“ä¸­æ–‡](README_zh.md) | [æ—¥æœ¬èª](README_ja.md) [Quick Start](#-quick-start) | [Theoretical Foundations](#-theoretical-foundations) | [Ecosystem](#-langgpt-ecosystem) | [Community](http://feishu.langgpt.ai)
--- ## ğŸ“– What is LangGPT? **LangGPT is a structured, reusable prompt design framework** that enables anyone to create high-quality prompts for Large Language Models. Think of it as a **"programming language for prompts"** â€” systematic, template-based, and infinitely scalable. ### Why LangGPT? Traditional prompt engineering relies on scattered tips and trial-and-error. LangGPT transforms this chaos into a structured methodology: - ğŸ¯ **Structured Templates** â€” Hierarchical organization inspired by programming paradigms - ğŸ”„ **Reusability** â€” Create once, adapt infinitely like code modules - ğŸ“¦ **Modularity** â€” Variables, commands, and conditional logic at your fingertips - âš¡ **Efficiency** â€” Go from idea to working prompt in minutes - ğŸŒ **Community-Driven** â€” 11,000+ stars, battle-tested by thousands of users > **Academic Foundation**: Published research at [arXiv:2402.16929](https://arxiv.org/abs/2402.16929) | [ä¸­æ–‡ç‰ˆ](Papers/LangGPT_paper_cn.md) --- ## ğŸš€ Quick Start ### Method 1: Use Automated Tools (Fastest) Let AI create prompts for you: - **[LangGPT GPTs](https://chat.openai.com/g/g-Apzuylaqk-langgpt)** â€” Full-featured generator (GPT-4) - **[Kimi+ LangGPT](https://kimi.moonshot.cn/kimiplus/conpg00t7lagbbsfqkq0)** â€” For Moonshot Kimi users - **[PromptGPT](https://chat.openai.com/g/g-YKe3gmydD-promptgpt)** â€” Lite version (GPT-3.5) ### Method 2: Master the Template (5 Minutes) Basic LangGPT structure: ```markdown # Role: Your_Role_Name ## Profile - Author: YourName - Version: 1.0 - Language: English - Description: Clear role description and core capabilities ## Goal - Outcome: What concrete result/outcome should be delivered for the user/session - Done Criteria: Clear acceptance criteria (how we know itâ€™s finished and good) - Non-Goals: What is explicitly out of scope to avoid scope creep ### Skill-1 1. Specific skill description 2. Expected behavior and output ## Rules 1. Don't break character under any circumstance 2. Don't make up facts or hallucinate ## Workflow 1. Analyze user input and identify intent 2. Apply relevant skills systematically 3. Deliver structured, actionable output ## Initialization As a/an , you must follow the , you must talk to user in default , you must greet the user. Then introduce yourself and introduce the . ``` **Prerequisites**: Basic Markdown knowledge ([Quick Guide](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/getting-started-with-writing-and-formatting-on-github/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax)) | GPT-4 or Claude recommended ### Method 3: Start from Examples Explore our [example library](https://langgptai.feishu.cn/wiki/RXdbwRyASiShtDky381ciwFEnpe) and adapt proven templates to your needs. --- ## ğŸ§  Theoretical Foundations Before diving into tactics, understand the principles. These essays explore the philosophy behind effective prompting: - **[å¯¹è¯åŠ¨åŠ›å­¦](Docs/å¯¹è¯åŠ¨åŠ›å­¦.md)** â€” The dynamics of human-AI dialogue - **[äº”ç§ç†æ€§](Docs/äº”ç§ç†æ€§.md)** â€” Five types of rationality in prompt design - **[é•œåƒæ€§å€¾å‘](Docs/é•œåƒæ€§å€¾å‘.md)** â€” Mirror tendencies in LLM behavior - **[ç»Ÿè®¡é‡åŠ›äº•å’Œè¾¹ç¼˜è¡¨è¾¾](Docs/ç»Ÿè®¡é‡åŠ›äº•å’Œè¾¹ç¼˜è¡¨è¾¾.md)** â€” Statistical gravity well and edge expression - **[å…³ç³»è¡¨è¾¾](Docs/å…³ç³»è¡¨è¾¾.md)** â€” Expressing relationships in prompts - **[çœ‹è§ä¸è¨€è¯´](Docs/çœ‹è§ä¸è¨€è¯´.md)** â€” Seeing and articulation in AI interaction - **[Prompt çš„æœ¬è´¨](Docs/Promptçš„æœ¬è´¨.md)** â€” The essence and nature of prompts - **[é¢å‘ç»“æœçš„æç¤ºè¯å†™ä½œæ–¹æ³•](Docs/é¢å‘ç»“æœçš„æç¤ºè¯å†™ä½œæ–¹æ³•.md)** â€” Writing prompts that focus on achieving desired outcomes - **[AIæ„è¯†](Docs/AIæ„è¯†.md)** â€” Understanding the role of AI in human-AI interaction - **[AIæ—¶ä»£çš„æ–°ç®¡ç†ï¼šæœºå™¨è´Ÿè´£ä¼˜åŒ–ï¼Œäººç±»å®šä¹‰åº”è¯¥](Docs/AIæ—¶ä»£çš„æ–°ç®¡ç†ï¼šæœºå™¨è´Ÿè´£ä¼˜åŒ–ï¼Œäººç±»å®šä¹‰åº”è¯¥.md)** â€” The new management in the AI era: machines optimize, humans define the criteria *These foundational insights will transform how you think about prompts.* --- ## ğŸ’¡ Core Concepts ### 1. Structured Roles Define AI personas through clear, modular sections: | Section | Purpose | Example | |---------|---------|---------| | **Role** | Role name/title | "é€»è¾‘å­¦å®¶" / "Expert Analyst" / "FitnessGPT" | | **Profile** | Identity and capabilities | "Expert Python developer with 10 years experience" | | **Goal** | Desired outcome, done criteria, and non-goals for this session/task | â€œRefactor a prompt into a reusable template; acceptance criteria: pass three structured checks; non-goal: rewriting the business logic.â€ | | **Skills** | Specific abilities | "Debug complex code, optimize performance" | | **Rules** | Boundaries and constraints | "Never execute destructive commands" | | **Workflow** | Interaction logic | "1. Analyze â†’ 2. Plan â†’ 3. Execute" | | **Initialization** | Opening message and setup | "As a , I will greet you and introduce the " | ### 2. Variables and References Use `` syntax for dynamic content: ```markdown As a , you must follow and communicate in ``` This creates self-referential prompts that maintain consistency across complex instructions. ### 3. Commands Define reusable actions for better UX: ```markdown ## Commands - Prefix: "/" - Commands: - help: Display all available commands - continue: Resume interrupted output - improve: Enhance current response with deeper analysis ``` ### 4. Conditional Logic Add intelligence to your prompts: ```markdown If user provides [code], then analyze and suggest improvements Else if user asks [question], then provide detailed explanation Else, prompt for clarification ``` ### 5. Advanced Techniques **Reminders** â€” Combat context loss in long conversations: ```markdown ## Reminder 1. Always check role settings before responding 2. Current language: , Active rules: ``` **Alternative Formats** â€” Use JSON/YAML when markdown isn't ideal: ```yaml role: DataAnalyst profile: version: "2.0" language: "Python" skills: - statistical_analysis - data_visualization ``` --- ## ğŸŒŸ Featured Examples | Prompt | Description | Link | |--------|-------------|------| | ğŸ¯ **FitnessGPT** | Personalized diet and workout planner | [View](examples/FitnessGPT.md) | | ğŸ’» **Code Master CAN** | Advanced coding assistant with debugging expertise | [View](examples/code_anything_now/ChatGPT-Code_Anything_Now_en.md) | | âœï¸ **Xiaohongshu Writer** | Viral social media content generator | [View](examples/chinese_xiaohongshu_writer/) | | ğŸ¨ **Chinese Poet** | Classical poetry composer in traditional styles | [View](examples/chinese_poet/) | [Browse 100+ more examples â†’](https://langgptai.feishu.cn/wiki/RXdbwRyASiShtDky381ciwFEnpe) --- ## ğŸ“š Learning Resources ### Essential Guides | Resource | Description | Date | |----------|-------------|------| | [Academic Paper](https://arxiv.org/abs/2402.16929) | LangGPT: Rethinking Structured Reusable Prompt Design ([ä¸­æ–‡](Papers/LangGPT_paper_cn.md)) | Feb 2024 | | [Structured Prompts Guide](Docs/HowToWritestructuredPrompts.md) | Comprehensive tutorial on building high-performance prompts | Jul 2023 | | [Prompt Chains](Docs/PromptChain.md) | Multi-prompt collaboration and task decomposition strategies | Aug 2023 | | [Video Tutorial](https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1rj411q78a) | BiliBili walkthrough (by AIGCLINK) | Sep 2023 | ### Advanced Topics - **[æ¨ç†æ¨¡å‹æç¤ºæ–¹æ³•å˜é©](https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/FLY0sy1jYv6eT9151Yz_jw)** â€” Paradigm shift from procedural to goal-oriented prompting - **[æç¤ºè¯çš„é“å’Œæœ¯](https://langgptai.feishu.cn/wiki/AYMWwBPaSih46WkAo9jcfKkfntg)** â€” Philosophy and practice of prompt engineering by æç»§åˆš - **[ä¼ä¸šçº§æç¤ºè¯å·¥ç¨‹](https://langgptai.feishu.cn/wiki/UTyswvusTiRw0TkZLI5cIG0Tnhc)** â€” Building production-ready prompt systems (ç™¾å·æ™ºèƒ½) - **[å¤šæ¨¡æ€æç¤ºè¯](https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/Aan9NXO_vEZ9h0YrugpoGQ)** â€” GPT-4V and multi-modal prompting techniques - **[æç¤ºè¯æ”»å‡»ä¸é˜²æŠ¤](https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/aaABXnxRqDF716qRk79wYQ)** â€” Security: prompt injection, jailbreaks, and defenses - **[å¤§æ¨¡å‹ç»˜ç”»æŒ‡å—](https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/bJbZ9bwPXxlpyREqLKhDvA)** â€” AI image generation with structured prompts ### Community Hub **[Feishu Knowledge Base](http://feishu.langgpt.ai)** â€” Curated resources, templates, and community contributions --- ## ğŸ¨ LangGPT Ecosystem ### Core Framework & Tools | Project | Description | Stars | |---------|-------------|-------| | **[LangGPT](https://github.com/langgptai/LangGPT)** | Core framework and methodology | ![](https://badgen.net/github/stars/langgptai/LangGPT) | | **[PromptVer](https://github.com/langgptai/PromptVer)** | Semantic versioning for prompts â€” version control like Git | ![](https://badgen.net/github/stars/langgptai/PromptVer) | | **[PromptShow](https://github.com/langgptai/PromptShow)** | Create beautiful prompt images ([Try it](https://show.langgpt.ai/)) | ![](https://badgen.net/github/stars/langgptai/PromptShow) | | **[Minstrel](https://github.com/langgptai/Minstrel)** | Multi-agent system for auto-generating prompts | ![](https://badgen.net/github/stars/langgptai/Minstrel) | ### Model-Specific Prompt Collections Rather than writing prompts as procedures, write the persona. Writing prompts as procedures gives the model steps and tools. Writing prompts as a persona gives the model a worldview, motivations, a value system, and a preference profile. Below are prompts that Yunzhong Jiangshu wrote while studying some well-known figures. * [å·´è²ç‰¹AIåˆ†èº«](Prompts/å·´è²ç‰¹AIåˆ†èº«.md) * [æ¢µé«˜AIåˆ†èº«](Prompts/æ¢µé«˜AIåˆ†èº«.md) * [é©¬æ–¯å…‹AIåˆ†èº«](Prompts/é©¬æ–¯å…‹AIåˆ†èº«.md) * [æ®µæ°¸å¹³AIåˆ†èº«](Prompts/æ®µæ°¸å¹³AIåˆ†èº«.md) Curated, optimized prompts for different AI models: | Collection | Target Model | Stars | |------------|--------------|-------| | [wonderful-prompts](https://github.com/langgptai/wonderful-prompts) | ChatGPT (Chinese) | ![](https://badgen.net/github/stars/langgptai/wonderful-prompts) | | [Discover 20+ more GPTs â†’](https://github.com/langgptai/LangGPT#langgpt-gpts) --- ## ğŸ¤ Contributing We welcome all contributions to make LangGPT better! ### How You Can Help 1. â­ **Star and beyond the Role structure 4. ğŸ“– **Improve docs** â€” Fix typos, clarify instructions, add translations 5. ğŸ’¡ **Suggest features** â€” Open issues with ideas for new capabilities 6. ğŸ”§ **Code Check out this [GitHub Minimal Contribution Guide](https://github.com/datawhalechina/DOPMC/blob/main/GITHUB.md) --- ## ğŸ“Š Star History [![Star History Chart](https://api.star-history.com/svg?repos=langgptai/LangGPT&type=Date)](https://star-history.com/#langgptai/LangGPT&Date) --- ## ğŸ“„ Citation If you use LangGPT in research or projects, please cite: ```bibtex @misc{wang2024langgpt, title={LangGPT: Rethinking Structured Reusable Prompt Design Framework for LLMs from the Programming Language}, author={Ming Wang and Yuanzhong Liu and Xiaoming Zhang and Songlian Li and Yijie Huang and Chi Zhang and Daling Wang and Shi Feng and Jigang Li}, year={2024}, eprint={2402.16929}, archivePrefix={arXiv}, primaryClass={cs.SE} } ``` --- ## ğŸ™ Acknowledgments LangGPT was inspired by excellent projects: - [yolov10](https://github.com/THU-MIG/yolov10) â€” Computer vision innovations ### Projects Built with LangGPT We're proud to see LangGPT principles applied in the wild: - **[Prompt Optimizer](https://github.com/linshenkx/prompt-optimizer)** â€” Intelligent prompt optimization tool leveraging LangGPT methodology - **[securityGPT](https://github.com/rryuliu/securityGPT)** â€” Secure prompt protection against leaks - **[AIPainting-Structured-Prompts](https://github.com/zhutyler21/AIPainting-Structured-Prompts)** â€” Structured prompts for AI art generation --- ## ğŸ“¬ Connect With Us ### Author **äº‘ä¸­æ±Ÿæ ‘ (Yun Zhong Jiang Shu)** - ## ğŸš€ Quick Start

### Method 1: Use Automated Tools (Fastest)

Let AI create prompts for you:

- **[LangGPT GPTs](https://chat.openai.com/g/g-Apzuylaqk-langgpt)** â€” Full-featured generator (GPT-4)
- **[Kimi+ LangGPT](https://kimi.moonshot.cn/kimiplus/conpg00t7lagbbsfqkq0)** â€” For Moonshot Kimi users
- **[PromptGPT](https://chat.openai.com/g/g-YKe3gmydD-promptgpt)** â€” Lite version (GPT-3.5)

### Method 2: Master the Template (5 Minutes)

Basic LangGPT structure:

```markdown
# Role: Your_Role_Name

## Profile
- Author: YourName
- Version: 1.0
- Language: English
- Description: Clear role description and core capabilities

ame
- Version: 1.0
- Language: English
- Description: Clear role description and core capabilities

## Goal
- Outcome: What concrete result/outcome should be delivered for the user/session
- Done Criteria: Clear acceptance criteria (how we know itâ€™s finished and good)
- Non-Goals: What is explicitly out of scope to avoid scope creep

### Skill-1
1. Specific skill description
2. Expected behavior and output

## Rules
1. Don't break character under any circumstance
2. Don't make up facts or hallucinate

## Workflow
1. Analyze user input and identify intent
2. Apply relevant skills systematically
3. Deliver structured, actionable output

d identify intent
2. Apply relevant skills systematically
3. Deliver structured, actionable output

## Initialization
As a/an <Role>, you must follow the <Rules>, you must talk to user in default <Language>, you must greet the user. Then introduce yourself and introduce the <Workflow>.
```

**Prerequisites**: Basic Markdown knowledge ([Quick Guide](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/getting-started-with-writing-and-formatting-on-github/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax)) | GPT-4 or Claude recommended

### Method 3: Start from Examples

Explore our [example library](https://langgptai.feishu.cn/wiki/RXdbwRyASiShtDky381ciwFEnpe) and adapt proven templates to your needs.

## ğŸ’¡ Core Concepts

### 1. Structured Roles

Define AI personas through clear, modular sections:

## ğŸ’¡ Core Concepts

### 1. Structured Roles

Define AI personas through clear, modular sections:

| Section | Purpose | Example |
|---------|---------|---------|
| **Role** | Role name/title | "é€»è¾‘å­¦å®¶" / "Expert Analyst" / "FitnessGPT" |
| **Profile** | Identity and capabilities | "Expert Python developer with 10 years experience" |
| **Goal**           | Desired outcome, done criteria, and non-goals for this session/task | â€œRefactor a prompt into a reusable template; acceptance criteria: pass three structured checks; non-goal: rewriting the business logic.â€                    |
| **Skills** | Specific abilities | "Debug complex code, optimize performance" |
| **Rules** | Boundaries and constraints | "Never execute destructive commands" |

ze performance" |
| **Rules** | Boundaries and constraints | "Never execute destructive commands" |
| **Workflow** | Interaction logic | "1. Analyze â†’ 2. Plan â†’ 3. Execute" |
| **Initialization** | Opening message and setup | "As a <Role>, I will greet you and introduce the <Workflow>" |

### 2. Variables and References

Use `<Variable>` syntax for dynamic content:

```markdown
As a <Role>, you must follow <Rules> and communicate in <Language>
```

This creates self-referential prompts that maintain consistency across complex instructions.

### 3. Commands

Define reusable actions for better UX:

consistency across complex instructions.

### 3. Commands

Define reusable actions for better UX:

```markdown
## Commands
- Prefix: "/"
- Commands:
    - help: Display all available commands
    - continue: Resume interrupted output
    - improve: Enhance current response with deeper analysis
```

### 4. Conditional Logic

Add intelligence to your prompts:

```markdown
If user provides [code], then analyze and suggest improvements
Else if user asks [question], then provide detailed explanation
Else, prompt for clarification
```

### 5. Advanced Techniques

**Reminders** â€” Combat context loss in long conversations:
```markdown
## Reminder
1. Always check role settings before responding
2. Current language: <Language>, Active rules: <Rules>
```

s check role settings before responding
2. Current language: <Language>, Active rules: <Rules>
```

**Alternative Formats** â€” Use JSON/YAML when markdown isn't ideal:
```yaml
role: DataAnalyst
profile:
  version: "2.0"
  language: "Python"
skills:
  - statistical_analysis
  - data_visualization
```

### Model-Specific Prompt Collections

Rather than writing prompts as procedures, write the persona. Writing prompts as procedures gives the model steps and tools. Writing prompts as a persona gives the model a worldview, motivations, a value system, and a preference profile.
